answers.text: Foundation for Ancient Research and Mormon Studies

qas.question: Who spearheaded the Critical Text of the Book of Mormon project?
How many years did it take to publish all three volumes of the Book of Mormon Critical Text?

answers.text: the first volume of the 3-volume Book of Mormon Critical Text in 1984. The third volume of that first edition was published in 1987

qas.question: Was the third volume of the first edition deemed sufficient?

answers.text: The third volume of that first edition was published in 1987, but was already being superseded by a second, revised edition of the entire work

qas.question: Who is the head of FARMS?
When was the fifth volume of Critical Text Project published?
What book did Grant Hardy publish in 1987?

plausible_answers.text: Foundation for Ancient Research and Mormon Studies

qas.question: Larson begin the research for what project?

context: By <b5_0>1979<b5_0/>, with the establishment of the <a0_0><b8_0>Foundation for Ancient Research and Mormon Studies<b8_0/><a0_0/> (FARMS) as a California non-profit research institution, an effort led by <a1_0><b9_0>Robert F. Smith<b9_0/><a1_0/> began to take full account of Larson’s work and to publish a Critical Text of the Book of Mormon. Thus was born the FARMS Critical Text Project which published <a2_0>the first volume of the 3-volume <b7_0>Book of Mormon Critical Text<b7_0/> in <b6_0>1984<b6_0/>. <a3_0>The third volume of that first edition was published in 1987<a2_0/>, but was already being superseded by a second, revised edition of the entire work<a3_0/>, greatly aided through the advice and assistance of then Yale doctoral candidate Grant Hardy, Dr. Gordon C. Thomasson, <a4_0>Professor John W. Welch<a4_0/> (the head of FARMS), Professor Royal Skousen, and others too numerous to mention here. However, these were merely preliminary steps to a far more exacting and all-encompassing project.
